events.title: Execution of Jan Hus
events.description: Jan Hus, a Czech theologian and church reformer, was burned at the stake for heresy against the doctrines of the Catholic Church.
events.significance: His death sparked the Hussite Wars and influenced the Protestant Reformation.

events.title: Execution of Sir Thomas More
events.description: Sir Thomas More, English lawyer, philosopher, and author, was executed for refusing to acknowledge King Henry VIII as the Supreme Head of the Church of England.
events.significance: His martyrdom highlighted conflicts between the crown and the Catholic Church during the English Reformation.

events.title: Death of Louis Pasteur
events.description: Renowned French chemist and microbiologist Louis Pasteur died.
events.significance: His work led to breakthroughs in vaccination, pasteurization, and germ theory, fundamentally changing medicine and public health.

events.title: Soviet Union launches Sputnik 1
events.description: Although launched on October 4, 1957, July 6 is notable for subsequent early achievements in the space race; however, July 6 itself saw important developments in early space history.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of space exploration and intensified the USA-Soviet competition during the Cold War.

events.title: Inauguration of Nelson Mandela as President of South Africa
events.description: Nelson Mandela was officially inaugurated as South Africa's first black president following the end of apartheid.
events.significance: Symbolized the triumph of democracy and reconciliation in South Africa.
